title: does riot members actually read these or are we just wanting answers from brick walls?
body: I've asked many questions and have seen many posts that I believe need answers and they just get a downvote from some idiot not having the guts to say why or just arrogant and not wanting to admit something is bullshit and unfair. like most of the community doesn't comment on these boards, and you have these "green and purple" labelled accounts just being toxic to us and they're meant to be the middle guys or the helpers of these boards? we want to find out answers from rioters not deal with wannabies or jerks.

replies.body: Greens/purples being toixc, what lmao, 9/10 times, they're trying to explain something, and ya'll just take it as a personal attack, Man the fuck up and stop complaining
They're explaining something that is clearly 9/10 times defending the shit out of Riot when they have done something stupid or aren't listening to the community.

Or you know, we're explaining the way things are to help people who don't know separate from our own opinions. Or you know, we simply agree or mostly agree with a given change. Or we think people are making assumptions based on too little info.

But I guess disagreeing is toxic now?

Its not, but when it happens 98% of the time..... How do you think thet are going to react... Just some form of acknowledgement might go along way as a work on rather then defending something that is an obvious mistake..

We try to do our best to acknowledge the other side when considering how to comment. Personally I always try to start with a "I see where you're coming from" before I dive into anything else. Doesn't mean we always succeed, but it's not uncommon that certain people think us disagreeing with them or agreeing with Riot means we're brainwashed as if it's simply not possible to disagree unless we're corporate slaves or something. If we believe there to be a shortcoming in x thing we try to be as transparent as we can.

Like any sort of organization, there are employees/volunteers that will be assholes, no matter what. But there are also some really helpful and nice people on the boards as well. I do believe that there is a large portion of the league community that is toxic, but not self-aware of it. However, there is still a large portion that is friendly and open. It's all about finding the right people that can help you. :)
What we need is Marauder and that consistently on the boards, or whoever replaced them, otherwise brick walls, the greens/purples help, but Riot need to be active too...
ye what happened to him/her I had good debates with them

[Marauder left Riot Games](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/i7uOancp-thank-you-and-farewell) a few months ago.

It would be good to see a few of the OCE Rioters taking a more active part in the boards, but at the same time they don't get payed to be on the boards all the time, anything outside of official announcements (and occasionally addressing a potential false positive) is all on their own time.

While the volunteers do help (or, at least, try to help), it sucks to not be seeing the reds being more active, especially considering how things have been going on the boards recently. Too much argument, not enough discussion, and basically no sign of the reds. When it all adds up, it makes for a deteriorating situation.
Riot members don't the volunteers can relay things to them, but they don't do it that often.
